metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14349 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was found that PostgreSQL versions before 12.4, before 11.9 and before 10.14 did not properly sanitize the search_path during logical replication. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw in an attack similar to CVE-2018-1058, in order to execute arbitrary SQL command in the context of the user used for replication.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14349` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libecpg6 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpq5 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-12 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-client-12 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plperl-12 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-12 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-12 - 12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-12 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
